level.heading: Cases in process.
level.text: Nothing in this chapter shall prevent the PSC from proceeding with respect to a formal case in process before the Commission so long as it is not inconsistent with the requirements of the federal Telecommunications Act of 1996.

level.heading: History
level.text: (Sept. 9, 1996, D.C. Law 11-154, ยง 4a, as added Sept. 9, 1996, D.C. Law 11-155, ยง 25(b), 43 DCR 4213.)

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 11-155
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-155, see Historical and Statutory Notes following ยง 34-2001.

level.heading: References in Text
level.text: The federal Telecommunications Act of 1996, referred to in this section, is Pub. L. 104-104, which is codified throughout Title 47 of the United States Code.
